div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1640 Benha el Asl (anc. Athribis), 50 km. (143) N of Cairo, 1929 Burial: c. 485 B.C. (Robinson) Contents: 77+ AR, 15 dumps Acanthus: 2 tetradr., 1 frag . Mende: 1 tetradr., 1 frag. Neapolis Maced.: 1 st., 1 frag. Orrescii: 3 st., 2 frag. Terone: 1 tetradr. Lete: 10 st. Thraco-Maced.: 2 tetradr. (sphinx) Abdera: 1 octadr., 1 frag. Thasos: 2 st. Chalcis: 1 tetradr. frag. Eretria: 1 didr. frag. Athens: 1 Wappenm. tetradr. 5 tetradr., 4 frag. Aegina: 2 st., 2 frag. Naxos: 1 st. Chios: 2 st. Phaselis: 1 st. Idalium: 1 st. Golgi: 2 st. Cyprus: 4 st. Unc.: 6 frag. Disposition: London 55, 15 dumps; New York 2 (Mende, Wappenm. tetradr.) † Robinson, NC 1930, pp. 93-106, illus.; NC 1931, pp. 68-71; NC 1932, p. 200 † Newell, NC 1931, pp. 66- 8 Schlumberger, L'argent glee, p. 10, no. 25
